div1.head: Military Orders for Robert P. Cooke, August 31, 1900
div1.p:
Adjutant General's
OFFICE,
SEP 14 1900
ROLLS DIVISION
[unclear]

FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Vol 247 A

HEADQUARTERS DEPT. OF WESTERN CUBA.
Quemados, August 31, 1900.

1. Under the provisions of A. R. 1272, the Subsistence
Department will commute the rations of Acting Hospital
Steward John L. Collins, U. S. Army, at the prescribed rate
of seventy-five cents per day, from August 1 to August 8,
1900, during which period he was on detached service at
Santa Clara, Cuba, and it having been impracticable to
provide for his subsistence in any other way.

2. The General Court-Martial which convened at Colum-
bia Barracks pursuant to paragraph 6, Special Orders No.
48, series 1900, Department of Havana and Pinar del
Rio, having been reduced to four members only, and
the proceedings in the case of Sergeant Andrew Diamond,
Light Battery A, 2d Artillery, containing a fatal defect in
that they do not show that the court and judge advocate
were sworn; the said proceedings are hereby declared a nul-
lity and the findings and sentence set aside. Paragraph 6,
Special Orders No. 61, series 1900, Department of Havana
and Pinar del Rio, is declared inoperative and is revoked.

3. Upon the recommendation of his company and regi-
mental commanders, the unexecuted portion of the sentence
in the case of Private Paul A. Kelly, Company F, 10th In-
fantry, promulgated in Special Orders No. 32, series 1900,
Department of Matanzas and Santa Clara, is hereby remitted.

Private Kelly, now reported in confinement at Hamilton
Barracks, Matanzas, will be sent by the commanding officer
of that Post to the station of his company at Rowell Bar-
racks, the Quartermaster's Department furnishing the neces-
sary transportation.

4. In accordance with instructions from Headquarters
Division of Cuba, contained in an endorsement dated Au-
gust 30, 1900, a board of officers, to consist of:
Acting Assistant Surgeon Robert P. Cooke, U. S. Army;

is hereby appointed to meet at Guanajay Barracks as soon
as practicable, for the purpose of appraising certain Quar-
termaster and Subsistence property consisting of wood, for-
age, ranges, street lamps, steam pumps and boilers, hose
carts, and other miscellaneous articles, and fixing the price
at which said articles should be sold by the Quartermaster
Department to the Department of Charities and Hospitals
of the Island.
BY COMMAND OF BRIGADIER GENERAL LEE:
